item.title: First sword model
item.dc:creator: @Ziva Ziva
item.description:
@Ziva wrote:

The Wanderer:

.obj doesn’t save material properties if I remember correctly.

the materials doesn’t matter that much as long u made the model export to obj then drag into mqo then make there the materials

item.title: First sword model
item.dc:creator: @Ziva Ziva
item.description:
@Ziva wrote:

[quote=“naseem142, post:5, topic:538387”][quote author=Vitkos link=topic=657210.msg4396781#msg4396781 date=1389382686]
Here are the all sides , sorry for so small size
And thx on feedbacks I will try my best on next models

Oh and one question
Can I mod in Maya/ 3Ds max / blender for RSPS ?
[/quote]

I did not try that , But i’m pretty sure you can. Though it’s going to be harder in maya/3Ds max/Blender.
I assumed that since you can import models from 3ds max into meta. correct me if i’m wrong.

OT: The sword doesn’t look flat from the side , Good job :D[/quote][quote=“The Wanderer, post:6, topic:538387”]Yes you can. You just need to find a way to open them in meta so you can save as a .mqo[/quote][quote=“xX4m4zingXx, post:7, topic:538387”]just get a key and you can open them.[/quote]
guys you don’t need a key. to open files in meta. all you need is once u made your model in maya blender or 3ds export to obj(wavefront) then just drag the obj into meta.

Read full topic

item.title: First sword model
item.dc:creator: @amy_webb1 amy_webb
item.description:
@amy_webb1 wrote:

Hey, first of all it is a nice design and pretty good for a first model. I’m not sure if it is your own design or just a chosen design from somewhere else so i’m going to go ahead and assume it is yours.

I’d like to start with your polygon count first, it’s far too high for the model. You can see areas such as the handle and blade which have faces where they don’t need to be. In between the middle line cut and the tip of the blade, you don’t need that many faces in there because the blades shape doesn’t change. This means if you remove those points from the area, the model won’t change but you’re poly count will go down.

I see you’ve gone for a magical look with the sword, however you should aim realistic except for the parts you know are magical. By this i mean the hilt size to the blade size, you may intend for this to have been a one hander but considering the size the hilt would have to be double the size it is now.

With strings, try made them so they’re straight down. I can see you wanted a movement effect but it looks like the sword grew legs and is running away. Also, try centring the middle of the blade in a straight line so it makes it easier to mirror and gives the model a cleaner look.

Would you mind posting a side view of the model? I’d like to see how you executed it on the 3d scale, thanks.

Read full topic

item.title: First sword model
item.dc:creator: @naseem142 naseem142
item.description:
@naseem142 wrote:

The concept is really nice but a bit weird , Also try making it look more “Realistic” by adding 3D depth to it.
Good job on first model.

Read full topic
